answers.answer: I am afraid I don't have the expertise you need to answer this question...so try one of the other forums...maybe the internal medicine, or even the diabetes forum, or a surgery forum...

question: I HAD GASTRIC BYPASS SURGERY ALMOST 10 YEARS AGO.  I WAS FINE UP UNTIL LAST YEAR WHEN MY GALBLADDER WAS REMOVED.  NOW I AM A SEVER HYPOGLYCEMIA PATIENT.  THE PROBLEM IS THEY WANT ME TO EAT MORE AND I CANT.  MY SUGAR NOW DROPS DOWN IN TO THE LOW 20'S. I AM NOW GOING THROUGH BLACKOUTS, AND CONFUSION. I KNOW THIS IS NOT NORMAL SO IS THERE ANYTHING ELESE THAT CAN BE DONE BESIDES EATTING MORE (I AM NOW EATTING EVERY 2 HOURS AND MUST BE AWAKENED TO EAT)
title: HYPOGLYCEMIA AND THE GASTRICBYPASS
